page.title: 01St.Nicholas' Church, Norton
page.content: St.Nicholas' is a small church in Norton village, in the diocese of St.Albans,which still is used today.It is about nine hundred years old,the Domesday book mentions a priest at Norton.The tower was built eight feet away from the church.In 1453 when the tower was finished the nave was then lengthened to join the tower,giving more than 3.6 m. extra space. There is a peal of eight bells which are still rung today,by the Norton guild of bell ringers for family services and Sunday services.The old north door is now blocked up so the southerly door is now used.The church is a quiet and tranquil place.The oldest of the pews being at least four hundred years old.Having been cared for the church may stand for a further nine centuries.
